channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2025040006
item.description:
Report E-2025040006

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-30
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Clean Harbors personnel arrived onsite and observed an estimated two hundred seventy-five (275) gallons were released from a two hundred seventy-five (275) gallon IBC plastic tote. It affected 100’-by-20’ area of concrete and a 3’-by-3’ area of trailer floor. It was damaged in the mechanical shop then placed on the trailer. Clean Harbors advised the mechanical shop that it needed pressure washed and flushed down the oil water separator. Granular absorbents were deployed to the affected areas. Clean Harbors then transferred seventy-five (75) gallons of remaining product into a new IBC plastic tote. It was then determined there were two hundred (200) gallons released. The generated waste was four (4) 55-gallon metal drums containing impacted absorbents and one (1) 85-gallon metal drum containing absorbents and cut up tote. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal. The ESTES terminal supervisor approved all work before Hepaco departed.

item.title: Report X-2025031540
item.description:
Report X-2025031540

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/19/2025 at approximately 1300 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a presumed gasoline spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained about 4 glass bottles of liquid. The shipment was discovered where liquid had completely absorbed into the outer packaging and emitted a gasoline odor. Further investigation revealed one broken bottle and a saturated safety data sheet "crude oil" inside of the box for; however, the odor from the shipment indicates otherwise. The shipment displayed an Excepted Quantities mark, but the amount of liquid in each inner contents appears to exceed the limits shown in IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held. pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025030444
item.description:
Report E-2025030444

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 26, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint and ten (10) 1-gallon pails of paint were punctured and released approximately eight (8) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Coastal Environmental Solutions (CS) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack, one (1) 55-gallon drum one (1) 35-gallon drum, and two (2) 5-gallon pails for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025031364
item.description:
Report X-2025031364

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS SUSPECTED TO CONTAIN UNDECLARED DANGEROUS GOODS DUE TO A SIMILAR PACKAGE BEING FOUND THE DAY PRIOR. THE REFERENCE SECTION OF THE THERMAL LABEL INDICATES DUST-OFF DISPOSABLE PK OF 2. CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS TWO CANS OF TEN OUNCE CAPACITY FALCON DUST-OFF ELECTRONICS COMPRESSED AS DUSTER, DUST AND LINT REMOVER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 21X49A, HALLSTAR, 520 BROOME RD, GREENSBORO NC 27406. THIS ACCOUNT USAGE IS SUSPECTED TO BE UNAUTHORIZED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 220F94, RICHARD FARAGO, 19 KYLEMORE DR, WESTFORD MA 01886. THIS ACCOUNT USAGE IS SUSPECTED TO BE UNAUTHORIZED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025030472
item.description:
Report E-2025030472

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:50 EST ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (LHO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, an unknown amount of NPS Sodium Persulfate (hazardous - UN1505) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor at dock door #9. The caller has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment and to bring drums for containment (Jeff Smith - Service Center Mgr approved). There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed less than a pound of the UN1505 Sodium Persulfate product released to a 1’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and impacting the shrink wrap due to improper loading. The crew overpacked the fiber drums (2) 55-gallon poly drums and placed the PPE into a 30-gallon poly drum and submerged the PPE in water prior. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025030458
item.description:
Report E-2025030458

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-17
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRUCKLOAD HOLDINGS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an area measuring approximately 2ft-by-2ft of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that four (4) gallons of material was released due to a forklift puncture on one (1) 10-gallon metal pail. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel deployed absorbent boom to prevent migration of the released material and used a neutralizer and granular absorbent to the impacted area. The spent material was gathered, and the recovered material was containerized into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Roadrunner Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025030049
item.description:
Report I-2025030049

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-15T00:53:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-09
  • City: TUSCOLA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STAR TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 51676
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Please see the attached Accident Report. The remediation is ongoing, as the affected area was a grass median splitting the highway and exit. The remediation company, Lone Star Hazmat, was on site immediately after the accident. Lone Star placed absorbent booms around the release, placed volcanic ash, and covered the affected area by a anchored tarp. Remediation efforts are ongoing and final reports will be shared with an updated form.
